ygData.subject: Re: EQ weekend update
ygData.msgSnippet: ... LOL, there are no high level bards playing because they get tired of being treated as mana batteries by high level casters :p Also as a high level bard I
ygData.messageBody:
>From: jhenders@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] EQ weekend update
>Date: Mon, 24 Jan 2000 12:37:55 -0800
>
>On Mon, Jan 24/00, kim@... wrote:
> >
> > A lot of times I wonder what it's like to play without a bard
> > in the group. :)
>
>Not much fun, though with clarity it's bearably. In fact, I try to avoid
>playing without an enchanter now. High level Bards are real rare on our
>server at high levels and there's only a couple of good ones. <Hi Downs>
>

LOL, there are no high level bards playing because they get tired of being
treated as mana batteries by high level casters :p

Also as a high level bard I can tell you I tire quickly of the second class
status in item lottos as well. I got into a long discussion about this at
the last Efreeti camp I took part in.


>Also, dispite what GZ said about pixie strike not being broken, it looks
>like they may have changed it recently. Our guild bard wanted to duel my
>druid while we were standing around last week after the patch and he
>basically locked me up with pixie strike. I wasn't able to move once if
>I got the message and icon. This is considerably different from my tests
>with the song months ago.

Pixie Strike WAS changed. It used to not have the MR reduction effect.
When it was a straight mez/stun song it was much more effective. The MR
debuff introduced the dreaded double save.

Rokenn
